alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 21 at 9:28PM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: .A cold arctic airmass is now covering northeastern Colorado. Decent wind speeds will cause dangerous wind chill readings. Light to moderate snow is fall and will continue overnight. The greatest snowfall will be in the higher mountains. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Winds gusting as high as 50 mph, snowfall accumulations up to 3 inches, dangerously cold wind chills as low as 55 below zero. * WHERE...The far northeast plains of Colorado, including northeast Weld, Morgan, Washington, Logan, Phillips and Sedgwick Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 11 AM MST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery roads. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County
